section.title: Technical background
section.para: There are two tables in the SQLite database: page and pageRef.

The page table contains a list of all existing pages. The pageRef table contains all child pages for a given page. A page must not appear as parent page in the pageRef table. Any page which is listed in the page table, but not as a child page in the pageRef table (means, it does not have a parent page), is considered an orphaned page.
When a new keyword is created on a page (by selecting text and applying the "keyword" style), the corresponding page is still non-existent.
Even when navigating to the new page (which creates an empty document with a page title only), the new page does not "exist" yet.
Only when the new page is edited and saved, it is made sure that the page exists in the page table, and that the pageRef table contains all linked pages.
